result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn Monte Lawrence

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court.  Attorney Patrick Thomas Earle in court for Deshawn Monte Lawrence.  Attorney John Rejowski for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Arguments heard as to bail. Court orders $1000.00 cash bail all other conditions of bail to remain. Any bail should be returned to the posting party. Defense request additional time. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court, appear by video with attorney Patrick Thomas Earle, appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared  by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Court took Judical Notice to Waukesha case 17CF1780. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Flannery.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for State v. Lee hearing.  SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court finds CAUSE to appoint Attorney Patrick Earle who shall be paid at the rate of $100.00 per hour at County expense. The court ordered the defendant is NOT REQUIRED to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees. Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense signed and filed. Case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel.  Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with Devon T.W-G; Kiara M.W and Dejon M.W
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Deshawn Monte Lawrence in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deshawn Monte Lawrence appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
